The OFT said it was concerned that the deal could lead to higher prices, reduced competition and a less diverse range of services for passengers.  The agency added that it was also worried that the deal could lead to a reduction in choice for passengers traveling between the UK and the US, as well as between the US and other countries.  The OFT has given the airlines until March 22 to provide further information and address its concerns.  If the concerns are not addressed, the agency will refer the case to the Competition Commission for an in-depth investigation.
